data.enText: of roads/buildings
the process or method of building or making sth, especially roads, buildings, bridges, etc.
the construction industry
road construction

data.chText: 新机场的修建已经开工。
data.enText: Work has begun on the construction of the new airport.

data.chText: 我们的新办公楼尚在修建中。
data.enText: Our new offices are still under construction (= being built) .
the construction of a new database
the way that sth has been built or made
strong in construction
ships of steel construction
building/structure
a thing that has been built or made

data.chText: 那座避暑别墅是简单的木结构建筑。
data.enText: The summer house was a simple wooden construction.
grammar
the way in which words are used together and arranged to form a sentence, phrase, etc.
grammatical constructions
of theory, etc.

data.chText: （理念、观点和知识的）创造，创立，建立
data.enText: the creating of sth from ideas, opinions and knowledge
the construction of a new theory
meaning

data.chText: （对词语、行为、陈述等的）解释，说明，理解
data.enText: the way in which words, actions, statements, etc. are understood by sb
What construction do you put on this letter (= what do you think it means) ?

data.text: structure ♦ framework ♦ composition ♦ construction ♦ fabric ♦ make-up

data.chText: 以上各词均指事物各个不同部分的组合、构造。
data.enText: These are all words for the way the different parts of sth combine together or the way that sth has been made.
structure
the way in which the parts of sth are connected together or arranged; a particular arrangement of parts
the structure of the building/human body
the social structure of society
the grammatical structures of a language
a salary structure
framework

data.chText: 指构成某个体系或社会基础的信仰、观点、准则：
data.enText: a set of beliefs, ideas or rules that forms the basis of a system or society

data.chText: 报告提供了进一步研究的原则。
data.enText: The report provides a framework for further research.
composition

data.chText: 指不同部分或人的构成、组合方式：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) the different parts or people that combine to form sth; the way in which they combine

data.chText: 劳动力组合最近的变化
data.enText: recent changes in the composition of the workforce
construction
the way that sth has been built or made
ships of steel construction
fabric

data.chText: 指社会、机构等的基本结构：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) the basic structure of a society or an organization that enables it to function successfully

data.chText: 这是威胁社会基本结构的趋势。
data.enText: This is a trend which threatens the very fabric of society .
make-up

data.chText: 指不同人或事物的构成、构成方式：
data.enText: the different people or things that combine to form sth; the way in which they combine
the genetic make-up of plants and animals

data.chText: 上述两词的主要区别在于使用场合的正式程度。composition较常用于科技语境，make-up则较常用于口语和新闻报道中。make-up亦指人的性格、气质。
data.enText: The main difference between these words is the level of formality. Composition is more often used in scientific and technical contexts; make-up is more often used in speech and journalism. Make-up also means the different qualities that combine to form sb's character.
composition or make-up?
the structure/framework/composition/construction/fabric/make-up of sth
the basic structure/framework/composition/construction/fabric of sth
the economic/political/social structure/framework/composition/fabric/make-up of sth
the chemical/genetic structure/composition/make-up of sth
a simple/complex structure/framework

simple_means.memory_skill: con 共同 + struct 建造，建立 + ion，construct 的名词 → 建设

ex.chText: 这座教堂是中世纪建筑风格的典型实例。
ex.enText: This church is a classic example of medieval architecture.

ex.chText: 最终她获得了建筑学的学位证书。
ex.enText: Finally she obtained a diploma in architecture.

synonyms.bx: 用于此义时，为不可数名词。

ex.chText: 公众强烈反对修建新机场。
ex.enText: There was a great outcry about the construction of the new airport.

ex.chText: 所有这些图片都取材于现代建筑。
ex.enText: All these pictures are about modern construction.

synonyms.bx: 指施工过程，也可指建造物本身。

ex.chText: 那座石结构建筑物可以追溯到明朝时期。
ex.enText: That stone structure dates back to the Ming Dynasty.

ex.chText: 那些外国专家对那座带拱顶的高大建筑物很感兴趣。
ex.enText: The foreign experts are quite interested in that high structure with an arch roof.

synonyms.bx: 指拥有多个部分的大型建筑物。

tr: drawing a figure satisfying certain conditions as part of solving a problem or proving a theorem
example: the assignment was to make a construction that could be used in proving the Pythagorean theorem
during the construction we had to take a detour
his hobby was the building of boats

tr: the commercial activity involved in repairing old structures or constructing new ones
example: their main business is home construction

tr: a complex entity constructed of many parts
example: the structure consisted of a series of arches
she wore her hair in an amazing construction of whirls and ribbons

tr: the process of combining ideas into a congruous object of thought
a group of words that form a constituent of a sentence and are considered as a single unit
example: I concluded from his awkward constructions that he was a foreigner

tr: an interpretation of a text or action
example: they put an unsympathetic construction on his conduct

value.def: Construction is the building of things such as houses, factories, roads, and bridges.

example.ex: He'd already started construction on a hunting lodge.
example.tran: 他已经开始建造一间狩猎用的小屋。

example.ex: ...the only nuclear power station under construction in Britain.
example.tran: 英国唯一一家在建的核电站

example.ex: Quincy wants a job in construction.
example.tran: 昆西想在建筑行业找一份工作。

value.tran: (房屋、工厂、道路、桥梁等的)建筑，建造

value.def: The construction of something such as a vehicle or machine is the making of it.

example.ex: ...companies who have long experience in the construction of those types of equipment...
example.tran: 长期从事此类设备制造的公司

example.ex: With the exception of teak, this is the finest wood for boat construction.
example.tran: 这是除柚木以外最好的造船木材。

value.def: The construction of something such as a system is the creation of it.

example.ex: ...the construction of a just system of criminal justice.
example.tran: 一套公正的刑事审判制度的创建

value.def: You can refer to an object that has been built or made as a construction .

example.ex: The British pavilion is an impressive steel and glass construction the size of Westminster Abbey.
example.tran: 这座英式亭阁是令人赞叹的钢和玻璃建筑，大小和威斯敏斯特教堂相当。

value.def: You use construction to refer to the structure of something and the way it has been built or made.

example.ex: The Shakers believed that furniture should be plain, simple, useful, practical and of sound construction...
example.tran: 震颤派教徒认为家具应当朴素、简单、有用、实用，并且结构合理。

example.ex: The chairs were light in construction yet extremely strong.
example.tran: 这些椅子构造轻巧，但却极为结实。

value.def: The construction that you put on what someone says or does is your interpretation of what it means.

example.ex: The denial was limited to rejecting the construction put on his remarks...
example.tran: 这种否认仅限于不接受对他所说话语的阐释。

example.ex: He put the wrong construction on what he saw.
example.tran: 他误解了所见到的事情。

value.tran: (对某人言行的)解释，理解，阐释

value.def: A grammatical construction is a particular arrangement of words in a sentence, clause, or phrase.

example.tran: 避免使用复杂的动词结构。

trans: 施工技术，建筑技术；建筑施工；建筑工艺学

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to build 建造, 建立
rootsaffixes.title: struct

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 共同 + struct 建造，建立 → 共同建立 → 建筑
con 共同 + struct 建造，建立 + ion，construct 的名词 → 建设
de 相反 + stroy〔= struct〕建造，建立 → 不建反而破坏
de 相反 + struct 建造，建立 + ible …的 → 违反建筑规格的 → 易毁坏的
de 相反 + struct 建造，建立 + ion 表名词 → 不建造 → 毁灭
de 相反 + struct 建造，建立 + ive …的 → 有破坏力的
in 使… + struct 建造，建立 → 使〔知识〕建立 → 指导
instruct 指导，教导 + ion 表动作，intruct的名词 → 教导，指导
instruct 指导，教导 + or 表人 → 教师，讲师
ob 反 + struct 建造，建立 → 反着建造 → 妨碍
ob 反 + struct 建造，建立 + ion，obstruct 的名词 → 阻碍；闭塞
re 重新 + construct 构造，建筑 → 重建
struct 建造，建立 + ure 表结果 → 构造；结构
sub 下 + struct 建造，建立 + ion 表名词 → 建在下面的 → 基础
super 上 + struct 建造，建立 + ure 行为有关的物 → 建在上面的 → 上层建筑
